column5: Left the kids at home and headed up to Jiggy for some R&R and a alone time weekend with Monique!!  We saved so much money buying Carling and our tackle at Dollarama we splurged on some great food!!  First off our Dollarama Derby Pictures.  I caught two bass and Monique caught a small pike.  I made a leader out of the wire we bought, but without a swivel, my line got pretty twisted which lead to an early end to the fishing.  Ill have to find real leaders at a  Dollarama somewhere.  Our Tackle Plate    First off here's my shining moments on FILM!!!    and the epic smallie battle!      Here's the pictures for the derby... We got three on and landed all three!!              Then of course Monique had to out do me and catch this monster!!! (Shes such a meanie!!)      So.. my entries... a total of 25 1/2 inches amd Moniques whopper - 10 1/2 inches.  All fish live released!!!  That night we went out pickeral fishing in front of the camp, caught two small ones for breakfast the next day and I snapped this shot.  I hope my wife doesn't find out about me new girlfriend!!    We also managed to drag the boat UP the rapids north of camp, Monique had never been there... We went till we saw another boat.. then returned home.    Here's some other pictures from the weekend.. I love going up just the two of us, when we can take our time and prepare an awesome dinner.  Night #1 - Crab Legs, Garlic Butter Fried Scallops, Jumbo Shrimp and Cheese and Spinach filled Ravioli in a Tomato Cheese sauce.    Night Two was prime rib, stuffed portobella mushrooms (PS.. note to self.. dont wait till 10:30 to eat... uhhg...)    and then wings on night three.. lol..  i was in too much of a hurry to take pictures...  We did wake up to a VERY large bees nest under the eave of the camp, here's me about to do battle....    As always a great trip, not a lot of wild life this time, most of the ducks have gone early it seems.  We did do a bunch of small jobs around camp.   till next time!!
what a weekend..............that's a beauty looking rod, nice handle  incredible feast you and monique had well done tambo
excellent report and story...  How far north is "the cabin" ?
Well done you 2.  See here folks.  It's not that you were a bad angler, TJ, you just did not have the right gear. Now nobody has an excuse to pick on ya no more.    WTG
LOL.. AND the handles are on the WRONG side for me and theres no way to change them.   Up by Matachewan, 500K as the crow flies from Toronto!
Thanks... Maybe I should be in the next adopt and angler contest, Im soooo hard done by!!
Did ya get any movies of you doin battle with the bees by chnace??????
LOL.. no.. wifeys alergic to them and wouldn't come out of the tent!!
dam.    ............Would have been a Classic..  ..Shoulda fitted her with the gear and sent you in with the the stick....
25  1/2"   That is going to be hard to beat.  I think I can do it though.  Going to be this week somethime I think!  Great start to the tourney.

Attaboy TJ You've just proven that a $3 rod and reel combo can catch some decent fish!!!  Well done you guys Looks like a fun time was had in shooting the vids  Thanks for sharing and again great job you 2!!! Leechman
CUDZ Just mentioned that the Tourney is all august long!!  lots of time for everyone to get in.. lol..  Id like to see some fish caught like this that make it to the main tourney!!
I'm sure there are a few of us at OFC that should be adopted by WFN
Awesome report.  Laughs, battles and booze.  You've got yourself a nice set-up there.  The rod, I mean.
So .... Bigfoot really does exist      (A little mange perhaps ?) Nice report TJ

LMAO--the STICK?......... or the Broom Handle?    no Goat and Dwarf i assume involved in their success!     2 Bass and a Pike?  3 for three?    nice scoff--day 1 two and three!    we got to get our game face on GBF!   and soon!  PM me... maybe--we can do the Barrie GIG-if the window is all of August  Cheers  Paul
which dollerama are you guys shopping at?? I went to the one by my house in brampton and they have no fishing gear.
What you saved on lures you put towards the dinner! Nice work TJ
T.J. ...that was awsome !!! those rods are remind me of my childhood when all we had wad those kind of rods and couple of lures...ha ha ha , that was funny
